intro: Merxmuellera ambalavaoensis, commonly known as the Ambalavao mallow, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom during the rainy season. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within humid forests. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
